content: Write some code that stores the following data in a dictionary. The dictionary must also have a key-value pair for the author of the play, William Shakespeare, and the year it was first performed, 1595.

Certainly! Below is a Python code snippet that creates a dictionary to store the play's information, including the author and the year it was first performed:

```python
# Create a dictionary to store play information
play_info = {
    "title": "Romeo and Juliet",
    "author": "William Shakespeare",
    "year_first_performed": 1595,
    "characters": ["Romeo", "Juliet", "Mercutio", "Tybalt", "Nurse", "Friar Laurence"],
    "setting": "Verona, Italy",
    "genre": "Tragedy"
}

# Display the dictionary
print(play_info)
```

This code snippet includes the title of the play, a list of some main characters, the setting, and the genre, in addition to the author and the year it was first performed. You can modify or expand upon the list of characters and other details as needed.
